result.execSummary:
The defendant Darryl W. Patterson was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Possession of Methamphetamine, a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(3g)(g).
  • Resisting or Obstructing an Officer, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 946.41(1).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes: Maintain fulltime employment, schooling, work search or combination.

Pay supervision fees in an amount to be determined by the Department of Corrections.

Submit to random urine screens and pay for same.

Maintain absolute sobriety; except for prescribed medications, taken in prescribed doses.

Any other counseling, treatment, assessments as recommended by the agent.

Submit a DNA sample and pay surcharge.

Assessment, treatment, counseling as deemed appropriate by the Department's assessment process.

If probation is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant in favor of restitution victims and/or governmental entities for the balance due.  All available enforcement actions will be used to collect the debt. 

$280.00 of court costs are from count 5 and ordered to be paid as a condition of probation on count 2.

supervisions.notes: Defendant is ordered to submit a DNA sample.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Darryl W. Patterson

records.addlTxt: Plea date on April 14, 2022 at 08:30 am.

3:14 p.m.  Defendant, in custody, waives his right to a preliminary hearing.  Defendant is bound over to Circuit Court Branch 3 for trial.
ARRAIGNMENT - 
Information filed. Copy served on defense counsel.
Not guilty plea(s) entered.  Jury calendar.
Plea date:  4/14/22, 8:30 a.m., Br. 3.
Minutes.
Plea date scheduled for April 14, 2022 at 08:30 am.

records.descr: Demand for Discovery and Inspection - Defendant

records.addlTxt: 3:05 pm - Prosecuting attorney Angelina R Scarpelli appeared by video for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant Darryl W. Patterson appeared by video, in custody at Manitowoc county jail.  Attorney Luke Harrison appearing with the defendant.  Defendant demands a preliminary hearing. Preliminary hearing is set for 03-30-22 at 1:30 p.m.
Preliminary hearing on March 30, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
Initial appearance on March 21, 2022 at 02:15 pm.
Commitment for Failure to Furnish Bail.

BAIL HEARING - 
Defendant in custody and appearing by video from the Manitowoc County Jail.  The State informs the Court that the defendant will be charged with the crime of possess methamphetamine, possess drug paraphernalia, possess schedule I or II drugs, obstruct officer and bail jumping.  The matter is continued for initial appearance on 03-21-22 at 1:30 p.m.  Bail is set at $500.00 cash bond with the conditions that he report to the Two Rivers Police Department for fingerprints, photographs and identifying information within 48 hours or, if incarcerated, within 72 hours of release and defendant must maintain absolute sobriety from alcohol and drugs.  Bail not furnished and defendant is remanded to the custody of the Sheriff.  
Minutes.
